title: Couldn’t process unknown directive ‘report-to’
content:
Hello there, I'm getting following warnings when I set report-to directive.

Content-Security-Policy: Couldn’t process unknown directive ‘report-to’ Content-Security-Policy: This site (http://puvipavan.local) has a Report-Only policy without a report URI. CSP will not block and cannot report violations of this policy.

These are the passed headers:

Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only: default-src https:; report-to csp-endpoint; Report-To: { "group": "csp-endpoint", "max_age": 5000, "endpoints": [ { "url": "https://example.com/csp-reports" } ] }

Am I missing something? I'm using the latest version of Firefox as of July-31-2023(115.0.3 (64-bit))
creator: Puvipavan

title: Changing CSS Property With Stylus Addon
content:
After removing elements from a website with another add-on, I'm left with a considerable white gap at the top.

I can manually change (pointless) the margin-top property to -100px, but how do I do this with the Stylus add-on?

Stylus doesn't like negative values:

margin-top -100px

10:20 Expected "{" but found "-100px".

Is there a lighter/simpler alternative to Stylus?
creator: silly1

title: BUG Drag-dropping inside a document fails with Uncaught DOMException: The operation is insecure
content:
When I start to drag a div to drop it in another div on the same page, it fails with the message:

"Uncaught DOMException: The operation is insecure. 

   dragstart_handler http://127.0.0.1:5000/main.js:7"

This is main.js:

``` function dragstart_handler(event) { 

   var t = event.target;    while (! t.draggable == "true" && t.tagName != "BODY") {        t = t.parentNode;    };    if (! t.draggable) return;    event.dataTransfer.setData("application/x-moz-node", t);

... ```

All dragging goes inside the same document, so "The operation is insecure" shouldn't happen.

Also I get an empty string when trying to get the draggable data:

``` function drop_handler(event) { 

   var t = event.target;    const parent = t.parentNode;    if (parent.id == "drag_area") {        event.preventDefault();        const data = event.dataTransfer.getData("application/x-moz-node");

Here's how I assign draggables and drop areas:

``` window.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => { 

   const dragArea = document.getElementById("drag_area");    dragArea.addEventListener("dragstart", dragstart_handler);    dragArea.addEventListener("dragover", dragover_handler);    dragArea.addEventListener("dragleave", dragleave_handler);    dragArea.addEventListener("drop", drop_handler);

}); ```

HTML:

```

Drag this

```
creator: asq

title: Accessibility issue: Disable (animating) overscroll
content:
I want to disable overscroll. For those who don't know: it's the bouncy animation when you use scroll using a two-finger gesture past the beginning or end of a scrollable region.

The bouncing is an animation, and with animations disabled on my system, having this animation is an accessibility issue.

I guess I could split this question in two:

1. Can Mozilla please change Firefox so that it doesn't do this animation when animations are supposed to be disabled? 2. How can I disable this overscroll behaviour manually, separately from other animations?
creator: thany

title: Firefox failed overnight, unable to install new download
content:
Apparently, overnight Firefox failed, monitor was still on leaving grey window with message "box" asking to close all tabs or cancel. Message box was frozen with "close all tabs" checked. Unable to do anything with cursor in that message box. Anytime the Firefox icon in taskbar is clicked, grey window appears.

Downloaded new Firefox and installed as usual, but old icon remains on taskbar, new icon never appears. The only Firefox icon on taskbar will only show the greyed screen. From my desktop I tried to "open" but Firefox will not open and the bad icon remains as only icon on the taskbar. I've tried to "unpin" the bad icon with no results.

For what it's worth, I've been using a "no-name" Father's day laptop since mid June and it has had no issues, performing great.

Any assistance will be greatly appreciated as I am not a happy camper on this "Edge". Will Babb willjag@yahoo.com
creator: willjag

title: [streamsb] Videos on the site are checked for malware, viruses.
content:
파이어폭스에서 [streamsb]사이트의 스트리밍 동영상을 확장프로그램[Video DownloadHelper]을 통해 다운받으면 다운이 완료될때 악성코드나 바이러스가 있다고 뜬다. 과거에는 이런 문제가 없었는데 얼마 전 부터 이런 증상이 나타나기 시작했다.

해당파일을 검사해봐도 바이러스가 없다. [streamsb]의 영상들 모두 증상이 나타나고 있다.

파이어폭스에서 다운하는 파일의 검사는 어떤엔진으로 검사되는가? 그리고 [streamsb]사이트의 동영상들이 갑자기 전부 그렇게 체크 되는건 어떤 이유인가?

When I download a streaming video of the [streamsb] site from Firefox through an extension program[Video DownloadHelper], it says there is a malicious code or virus when the download is complete. There were no such problems in the past, but these symptoms began to appear not long ago.

There is no virus when I check the file. All the videos in [streamsb] are showing symptoms.

What engine inspects files that are being downloaded on Firefox? And why are all the videos on [streamsb] sites suddenly checked like that?
creator: vfz09400

title: Viewing media in fullscreen mode adds black borders around the screen.
content:
When I play a video in fullscreen, there is a strange black border that appears around the video which makes the content smaller than it would otherwise be. This border does not display in Safari or Chrome, just in Firefox. It also occurs in every media player I've tested, including YouTube and Netflix.

Annoyingly, I can't get this to show up in a screenshot. It seems like Firefox guesses the aspect ratio or resolution wrong when it puts media in fullscreen, and it has the effect of downsizing the actual interactive part of the display. Meaning, I can't move my mouse into the border area to take a screenshot of it.

I'm on an ARM Macbook running MacOS 13.5, if that matters.

Is this a bug, and/or is there a way to fix this?
creator: tsedan

title: Firefox place holder icon has been hijacked

Nothing has worked. I took a screen shot and it is attached. When ever I open a new tab this symbol appears for a few seconds and then changes to the icon of what I am opening, G for google, H for HULU etc. I am worried that it is some type of Malware but none can be found on my system.

Any ideas or help would be greatly appreciated. Windows 7 64 bit all service packages

creator: ricdoery

title: recover auto generated password
content:
I created an account today and let Firefox generate a password, clicked save and everything seemed normal. but when i went to login on another devise and pulled up the password i find is my SSN.

I am baffled how this happened. Why is it not designed it automatically save the created password when creating the password? Why and How did it find and save my SSN? I don't understand how the computer messed that up, I created and saved the password then I gave my information including my SSN to finish creating my account. Then the last step to create the account was to download the app and login on my phone. So I go to my Logins and passwords and find the password it saved was my SSN not the random password it created the account with.

I don't know what to do, probably have to start over if it cannot be recovered. But I want to complain about about Firefox picking out my SSN. Failing to save the password is one thing, But replacing it with my SSN is wrong. And i do not think I made a mistake here when all I did was click two buttons, create password and save password. they popped up one after the other I clicked them both in seconds from one another. My SSN was not on the page at the time, I created and saved the password and gave my SSN in different steps one before the other. I cannot rationalize how this happened.
creator: abmgjones

title: Default Session Setup
content:
Dear Well Loved, Firefox community.

I wanted to ask if theirs a trick to, or if not, ask for a how to ask mozilla to create a new functionality for storing you Default Session Setup.

Whats the idea, is very simple. This surges, for my needs of how I use the tool.

Somewhere, 70%-90% of my work week hours are spent on a browser, specific on the very best and my first love, Firefox (well si was not may first, but it the closest to Netscape, my true love). For organization reasons, I always open my tabs on the same order and pin the first 4 to 5 tabs, there are my top 4 to 5 tools, example: my email, my calendar, messaging (whatsapp or slack), , my comapy tab (erp, crm, wms, etc).

So it will be nice, that at any divice I'm login, every time I open my Firefox this pin tabs always open first, so that my working setup is open wright away.
creator: josepato
